* Text Formatting

Testing all inline text formats supported by Ghost's Lexical editor.

** Basic Formats

This paragraph has *bold text* in it.

This paragraph has /italic text/ in it.

This paragraph has _underlined text_ in it.

This paragraph has +strikethrough text+ in it.

This paragraph has ~inline code~ in it.

This paragraph has =verbatim text= in it.

** Scientific Notation

Water molecule: H_{2}O (subscript)

Einstein's equation: E=mc^{2} (superscript)

** Combined Formats

Combined */bold italic/* text here.

Triple */_bold italic underline_/* formatting.

Nested ~code with *bold* inside~ test.

** Special Inline

This has @@ghost:highlight:highlighted text@@ here.

* Code Blocks

** JavaScript

#+BEGIN_SRC javascript
console.log("Hello, world!");

function fibonacci(n) {
  if (n <= 1) return n;
  return fibonacci(n - 1) + fibonacci(n - 2);
}

const result = fibonacci(10);
console.log(`Fibonacci(10) = ${result}`);
#+END_SRC

** Python

#+BEGIN_SRC python
def hello():
    """A simple greeting function."""
    print("Hello from Python")

class Calculator:
    def add(self, a, b):
        return a + b

calc = Calculator()
print(calc.add(2, 3))
#+END_SRC

** Go

#+BEGIN_SRC go
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
    fmt.Println("Hello, Go!")

    for i := 0; i < 5; i++ {
        fmt.Printf("Count: %d\n", i)
    }
}
#+END_SRC

* Toggle Cards

Collapsible sections with rich content.

#+BEGIN_TOGGLE :heading "What is Ghost?"
Ghost is a powerful app for professional publishers to create, share, and grow a business around their content.

Features include:
- Modern editor with cards
- Native newsletter support
- Membership & subscriptions
- SEO optimization built-in
#+END_TOGGLE

#+BEGIN_TOGGLE :heading "Installation Guide"
To install ox-ghost:

1. Clone the repository
2. Add to your Emacs config:
   #+BEGIN_SRC elisp
   (add-to-list 'load-path "/path/to/ox-ghost")
   (require 'ox-ghost)
   #+END_SRC
3. Export with =M-x org-export-dispatch=
#+END_TOGGLE

#+BEGIN_TOGGLE :heading "Troubleshooting FAQ"
*Common issues and solutions:*

| Problem | Solution |
|---------+----------|
| Empty output | Check UTF-8 encoding |
| Missing images | Use absolute URLs |
| Card not rendering | Verify syntax |

For more help, visit the [[https://github.com/ii/ox-ghost/issues][GitHub issues]].
#+END_TOGGLE

*About the Author*

This content was created to demonstrate ox-ghost's capabilities. The project bridges org-mode and Ghost CMS, enabling literate programming workflows for content publishing.

Visit [[https://github.com/ii/ox-ghost][the repository]] for more information.

#+BEGIN_ASIDE
*Key Terminology*

- *Lexical* ‚Äî Meta's rich text editor framework
- *org-mode* ‚Äî Emacs' plain-text markup system
- *ox-ghost* ‚Äî Bridge between the two worlds
- *Koenig* ‚Äî Ghost's editor built on Lexical
#+END_ASIDE

** Markdown Card

#+BEGIN_MARKDOWN
## Markdown Card Features

This card renders **Markdown** directly, useful for:

- Importing existing content
- Using Markdown-specific syntax
- Task lists and footnotes

### Task List

- [x] Set up ox-ghost
- [x] Create test fixtures
- [ ] Write documentation
- [ ] Release v1.0

### Blockquote

> The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
>
> ‚Äî *Steve Jobs*

### Fenced Code

```javascript
const ghost = require('@tryghost/admin-api');
await ghost.posts.add({title, lexical});
```

### Footnotes

Markdown supports footnotes[^1] for references.

[^1]: This appears at the bottom of the rendered content.

---

*Perfect for importing existing Markdown content.*
#+END_MARKDOWN

* Final Notes

This comprehensive style test covers all Ghost Lexical node types:

1. *Text nodes*: paragraph, heading, text (8 formats), linebreak
2. *List nodes*: list, listitem (ordered, unordered, checkbox)
3. *Block nodes*: quote, codeblock, horizontalrule
4. *Card nodes*: image, gallery, video, audio, file, callout, toggle, button, header, bookmark, embed, cta, aside, email, email-cta, signup, product, paywall, transistor, html, markdown

Generated from Ghost's official kg-default-nodes test suite.
